sentences: Olen todella kiireinen tänään, minulla on paljon tehtävää.
Älä huoli, en ole kiireinen nyt, voin auttaa sinua.
Kiireiset aikataulut ovat normaaleja suurissa kaupungeissa.
context: The Finnish word 'kiireinen' is an adjective that means busy, rushed, or hurried. It describes a state of having many things to do and not much time to do them. The suffix '-inen' is commonly used to form adjectives in Finnish.  It declines based on case (nominative, genitive, partitive etc.) as shown in the dictionary definition, and can also be possessive, indicating who is busy.
